column4: is there a way to tell Ubuntu that a certain IP is already taken and to choose another?
I tried static and got a connection but still couldn't ping google
sounds like you forgot gateway/DNS info
nope I know not to miss anything and I checked and rechecked all ip #'s
I have had SuSE running on the same netwerk and other machines plugged into my system

what exactly is the problem? DHCP is giving you an address that is in use? Theres only 3 things that could cause that, Duplicate MAC addresses, DHCP Leases being too short and Someone assigning a Static IP that is in the DHCP lease range
good list of questions.... I can't figure it out either and I am a netwerk speciallist with WinBlows
I will eventually finger this out..... I was just seeing if it was a simple mistake that I was making
a static address should work, if its not working then theres something more than a duplicate IP involved
ok thank you.  I can't finger this out atm but I will
and at that, a dup IP will work intermittently
think I should also install wicd?
no in your case i would uninstall both and configure by hand
I configured by hand earlier today..... lol she was really cute too
